paper_abstract: We investigate semantics for classical proof based on the sequent calculus. We show that the propositional connectives are not quite well-behaved from a traditional categorical perspective, and give a more refined, but necessarily complex, analysis of how connectives may be characterised abstractly. Finally we explain the consequences of insisting on more familiar categorical behaviour. (C) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Categorical proof theory of classical propositional calculus
